title: 115_hr2185
content: The Act is titled the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act." It involves determining if certain foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The President must determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. Certifications of these determinations must be transmitted to congressional committees. The President must determine if foreign financial institutions have knowingly facilitated transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. Certifications of these determinations must be transmitted to congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant based on regulations in title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. DETERMINATION AND CERTIFICATION OF FOREIGN PERSONS SUPPORTING COVERED PERSONS. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have supported certain individuals and report to congressional committees every 180 days. The determination must be in unclassified form but may include a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. A covered person includes an organization designated as a foreign terrorist organization by the Secretary of State or a foreign person whose property is blocked under specific Executive Orders related to terrorism and weapons of mass destruction proliferation. The curr_chunk lists various Executive Orders related to the blocking of property of weapons of mass destruction proliferators and their supporters, including orders related to Syria and the national emergency with respect to Syria. The curr_chunk summarizes Executive Orders related to blocking property in connection with the national emergency regarding Syria, including orders targeting human rights abuses and senior officials of the Syrian government. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders targeting property blocking and transactions related to Syria, Iran, and human rights abuses. The curr_chunk outlines the entities targeted by Executive Orders related to Iran, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to Executive Orders targeting entities in Iran, such as the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to Executive Orders targeting entities in Iran, such as the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. In this Act, key terms like "appropriate congressional committees," "foreign financial institution," and "foreign person" are defined. The curr_chunk defines terms related to entities in Iran, including "foreign terrorist organization" and "Iranian financial institution." These terms are crucial for understanding Executive Orders targeting such entities. The curr_chunk defines terms related to Iran, including "Iranian financial institution" and "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action" agreed upon in Vienna on July 14, 2015. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to Iran, such as "person" and "United States person," as outlined in agreements related to the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action.
